bibl.title: Bone and Ivory Carvings in Early Christian Alexandria.
bibl.note: Communication présentée aux Troisièmes Journées d'études sur Alexandrie médiévale, Le Caire, 8-10 novembre 2002. - Analyzes a few significant reliefs from the collection of ivory and bone carvings found during the recent French excavations in Alexandria. Most of the reliefs fall into the group of secular items, dated to the Roman and Byzantine periods.
bibl.seg: RODZIEWICZ Elzbieta, Bone and Ivory Carvings in Early Christian Alexandria.
Jean-Yves EMPEREUR et Christian DÉCOBERT (Édd.), Alexandrie médiévale 3 = Études alexandrines. 16 (Le Caire, 2008) pp. 247-262, 17 figg.

Communication présentée aux Troisièmes Journées d'études sur Alexandrie médiévale, Le Caire, 8-10 novembre 2002. - Analyzes a few significant reliefs from the collection of ivory and bone carvings found during the recent French excavations in Alexandria. Most of the reliefs fall into the group of secular items, dated to the Roman and Byzantine periods.
